identified-content.object.title: Advertising (Times Column)
identified-content.classifier: Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Marketing, Advertising and PR

abstract.p: BMW of North America begins review of its advertising account that is currently handled by Washington Daniel Advertising (S)

block.p: BMW of North America, part of BMW A. G., has begun a review of its multicultural advertising account, which has been handled by Washington Daniel Advertising in Chicago for the last two years. Billings were not disclosed.

Martha McKinley, a spokeswoman for BMW in Woodcliff Lake, N.J., said the company wanted to explore its options as the contract with Washington Daniel nears expiration at the end of the year, adding that Washington Daniel would take part in the review. BMW will start contacting other agencies to take part, she said, with a decision expected by March.

BMW of North America, part of BMW A. G., has begun a review of its multicultural advertising account, which has been handled by Washington Daniel Advertising in Chicago for the last two years. Billings were not disclosed.

Martha McKinley, a spokeswoman for BMW in Woodcliff Lake, N.J., said the company wanted to explore its options as the contract with Washington Daniel nears expiration at the end of the year, adding that Washington Daniel would take part in the review. BMW will start contacting other agencies to take part, she said, with a decision expected by March.

Numerous marketers, including General Motors and PepsiCo, have also been making changes on their assignments to create campaigns aimed at black, Hispanic, Asian-American and other multicultural consumers. The online editions of Advertising Age and Adweek reported last week that the Kmart Corporation would shift its multicultural accounts to other agencies. Dave Karraker, a spokesman for Kmart, declined to comment.
